channel.title: Need help- willing to do anything- tried for over 9 hours and cant fix!
channel.description: I have toms cache editor and theres nothign in there to change the battlescape client background, i really am about to pay somebody to help, can anybody give me a location to change this, i looked in all the chache and unable to find shit.

item.title: Need help- willing to do anything- tried for over 9 hours and cant fix!
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

First of all download the tool that Palidino provided for this.
http://uppit.com/v/7N3HONLP

and undo all the things people told you to do on here.

make sure you extract it.

Go into the Images folder
(Image_Packer\Images)

replace “background_0” with yours, make sure it’s in .png format.

go back to the main directory
(Image_packer)

Hit pack.

replace the Images.dat with the one in your battlescape client cache.

and there you go.

if that doesn’t work then your a complete retard. i just did it to the spare BS client i have around.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help- willing to do anything- tried for over 9 hours and cant fix!

item.title: Need help- willing to do anything- tried for over 9 hours and cant fix!
item.dc:creator: @Slayer6533 Slayer6533
item.description:
@Slayer6533 wrote:

/* “background_0” */ didn’t work. It compiled. But then the image was still there. I noticed that there were several background images so I took the liberty of commenting all of them out. The client loaded up, everything works perfectly, EXCEPT one thing…

The background was replaced with a steelborder image… So in the top left corner, its a little white box with borders around it, the borders form a backwards ‘L’.

I tried toms suite, pali’s image packer, EVERYTHING. If someone gets this to work, I will be there personal programmer for life. And yes…I am a programmer, I don’t do little kid shit that people think is programming (e.g. rsps ‘coding’). I don’t ‘code’ rsps sources. I make them, I design them. I know Java BEYOND game programming. So yes, I will be of great help to you if you figure this little sprite problem for me.

You’re probably wondering, “well, since you know java so well, why cant you fix it smart one!”

that’s because the Images.dat file isn’t written in java, it’s a different type of hexadecimal location and structure. A .DAT image UNpacker is all I need. I googled for one, and all the one’s i found are useless.

Anyone up for the challenge?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help- willing to do anything- tried for over 9 hours and cant fix!
item.dc:creator: @dannydude8 dannydude8
item.description:
@dannydude8 wrote:

in the battlescape folder. Go to the top and click tools. then folder options. click the tab that says view. then for hidden files/folders click show hidden files and folder. it also might not be in the cache but main folder

Read full topic
